body:
During the first six years of his marriage, Pat Marino — fueled more by spontaneity than hunger — would rouse his wife, Theresa, in the middle of the night and propose a jaunt to a nearby diner.
 
There, they would nibble food and converse for hours, a custom so familiar to the servers that they would leave a full pot of
title: THE NEEDIEST CASES; A Flair for Spontaneity Is Dimmed by a Painful Disease

body:
New York City public school students will return to classes on Monday morning, but some of them will not go to the buildings they left last week. 
 
Forty-four buildings housing 79 schools were severely damaged by the storm, Dennis M. Walcott, chancellor of the city’s Education Department, said Thursday in a news briefing. Students
title: Schools, Some Relocated, Will Reopen Monday

author: E-mail: geovec@nytimes.com
body: Brooklyn giveth and Brooklyn taketh away. The borough that carried a victim's posture for half a century is now collecting sports franchises. At least Brooklyn is not spiriting away much of anything from the haunted house farther out on Long Island. Maybe the nickname of the team; maybe the orange and blue colors. But Brooklyn cannot carry away the
title: SPORTS OF THE TIMES; Islanders Leaving, the Glory Long Gone

body: Each time a Brooklyn kingmaker falls in this borough of the back-room deal -- the tenures of three of the last four Democratic bosses have ended in scandal -- the outrage turns to an outcry for one of New York's last political machines to be dismantled. Though former Borough President Howard Golden served without dishonor, his successor,
title: Likely Successor to Disgraced Brooklyn Party Leader Is a Friend and Protégé

body: A passenger in a livery cab was shot in the head early Saturday when a man held up the driver after the cab stopped at a traffic light in Brooklyn, according to the police.The shooting occurred about 2:30 a.m. at Utica Avenue and Avenue M, in the Flatlands neighborhood. The robber approached the driver's side window on foot, demanded money and
title: Passenger Is Shot in Livery Cab

body: The Anti-Capitalist Brigade started gathering early on May Day at Oakland's Snow Park. There was free coffee, oatmeal, doughnuts, fliers with the day's agenda and plenty of pot. A ''street medic'' -- ''I just finished a wilderness first-aid course,'' he told me when I asked about his training -- tended to his first case of the day, a man in his 20s
title: The World Capital of Anti-Capitalism

body: There's ''Brooklyn's Finest,'' ''Brooklyn Rules'' and ''Brooklyn Lobster,'' and later this week there is the Art of Brooklyn Film Festival, which runs Aug. 4 to 12 at St. Francis College in Brooklyn Heights and features 45 premieres that all have links to that borough, New York City's most populous. The independent movies include a Turkish film
title: ARTS, BRIEFLY; Film Festival Celebrates Brooklyn

body: When dark smoke rose from a manhole outside Trump Tower in Manhattan on Monday afternoon, it looked like a sign of the sort of trouble that Consolidated Edison has dreaded for the last three weeks. With the temperature hovering near 90 degrees, electrical cables had started to burn beneath the pavement at the intersection of Fifth Avenue and 56th
title: At Con Ed, the Managers Are Tasked With Repairs
